WorkItem.ClosedComment: If you are sure the linked issue is the same thing you're hitting then we can track it there, but if you are unsure feel free to re-open this with any additional information you can provide. We certainly want to track down issues like this. If you're able to provide a repro (even if it's a large project you can only share privately) we'd be happy to take a look.
WorkItem.Description:
We have a large project consisting of several d.ts and .ts files.
When writing code that uses generic parameters, and often by just writing the wrong parameters or missing a type parameter when calling a method, the tsc compiler will hang, and eventually go out of memory. The errors I have to find my self...
I don't have an isolated sample for you right now, but it's happening a lot to me, daily, and finding the specific issue gets extremely hard as the codebase grows. I will look to provide a sample that shows the issue...

Our settings are (I played with them, but it didn't make any difference):
* ECMAScript5
* Compile on Save
* Do not allow implicit any
* Combine Javascript output into file
* generate source maps

edit: I'm sorry, I totally forgot there was an existing issue: https://typescript.codeplex.com/workitem/2011
I was frustrated and didn't find this issue today... :)
